plugins.name: Duplicate main component
plugins.description:
Duplicate Main Component' is a time-saving Figma plugin designed for UI/UX designers, front-end developers, and anyone frequently working with component sets in Figma. This plugin effortlessly clones your main component and repositions the duplicate, streamlining your workflow.


Features:


  • One-Click Duplication: With just a single click, replicate your selected main component.
  • Smart Positioning: Automatically places the duplicate below the original, with a customizable margin for neat organization.
  • Viewport Focus: After duplication, the plugin zooms in on the new component, making immediate edits simpler.


How to Use:


  • Select Your Component: Click on the main component you wish to duplicate within your Figma file.
  • Activate the Plugin: Go to Plugins > Duplicate Main Component.
  • Instant Duplication: The plugin clones the selected component and positions it neatly below the original.
  • Edit As Needed: Your duplicate is now ready for any modifications or adjustments.


Ideal For:


  • Designers working with extensive UI component libraries.
  • Teams needing a quick way to create variations of a master component.
  • Anyone looking to enhance their efficiency in Figma.


Save Time, Enhance Productivity:


'Duplicate Main Component' is more than just a cloning tool; it's a productivity booster for your design process in Figma. Say goodbye to tedious manual duplication and hello to streamlined design workflows.

plugins.name: Blue Pencil
plugins.description:
Maintain formal design specs with markup based organization and content generation features.


Current Features

  • Frame Tidying
  • Frame Numbering
  • Frame, Page, and File Name Injection
  • Last Modified Date
  • Table of Contents Generation


Usage

Most of the features of this plugin rely on a layer name including specific markup such as {framename} that controls how content is updated. Other features such as the automatic frame arrangement are more passive and help keep the document organized.


The plugin has a UI that provides preferences for each feature and shows the markup needed for each. The plugin may also be run using the "Revise" command which skips the UI but uses the most recent settings from the UI.

accepted.name: Riley
accepted.description: UX Designer at SAS

plugins.name: Getillustrations Icons, Illustrations and 3D Design Assets
plugins.description:
Access a Library of unique Hand-Drawn Vector Assets – Updated Weekly!


The Getillustrations Figma Plugin brings the entire illustrations bundle to your Figma workspace, including all new weekly updates with fresh icons and illustrations. Our assets are fully hand-drawn from scratch, crafted through years of market research, and shaped by client feedback, establishing us as a trusted authority in the world of unique and high-quality vector assets. With over 11 years in the industry, we are dedicated to providing designers and creators with unparalleled quality and innovation in every style.


Key Features:

  1. Expansive Asset Library: Access Thousands of illustrations, icons, 3D graphics, and stickers in various styles and categories, with new additions every week.
  2. Quick and Easy Search: Find assets quickly with our powerful local search, filtered by style, category, free or premium access. Getillustrations ensures a fast and intuitive browsing experience so you can focus on creating.
  3. Limitless Customization: Easily drag and drop assets into your design, with full vector editing options, including color and size adjustments. Designed to adapt to your needs, each asset maintains its quality across any customization.
  4. Fully Integrated with Figma: No need to switch tools—Getillustrations is seamlessly built into Figma, enabling you to browse, preview, and use assets directly within your design environment.
  5. Hand-Drawn Uniqueness: Our illustrations are one-of-a-kind, developed from scratch based on years of client feedback and research, making each style distinctive and tailored to current market needs.


Why Choose Getillustrations?

Our dedication to originality and quality has made us an industry leader in illustration and icon design. With Thousands of assets and continuous weekly updates, you’ll always find fresh assets for your projects. The Getillustrations plugin offers both free and premium options to suit any design requirement.


What Users Are Saying

"A fantastic library of high-quality illustrations that bring projects to life. It’s user-friendly and comprehensive." — Lucas Diab

"The styles are diverse and perfect for my work. It’s my go-to for unique and well-crafted illustrations." — Julian Colina

"An essential tool for designers! The organization and variety make it a top resource for any creative project." — Joe Taylor


FAQ:

  1. What license do I have on these assets? You have a Standard Commercial Usage License with unrestricted use in your or your clients’ designs. There are no limitations on views or projects.
  2. What does the plugin offer? Free users enjoy access to high-resolution free illustration packs. Paid users unlock the entire library without restrictions or download limits
  3. Do I have to create an account? Yes, logging in connects you to the Getillustrations library. Signing up is simple and can be done via Google for a seamless experience.
  4. What about free sets? Free sets and low-quality assets are available with https://www.getillustrations.com/. Premium users have unrestricted use without attribution.
  5. More questions? Reach out to our support team via the chat widget on our website for additional help.


Unlocking Full Access:

As a free user, you gain access to low-resolution PNGs for all our assets, with high-quality images available for free sets. To unlock the entire library, simply upgrade on Getillustrations.com and link your account. Once upgraded, you’ll instantly have full access to all assets in high resolution right within Figma.


Experience the power of Getillustrations in Figma – where creativity meets quality. Join thousands of designers who rely on our assets to bring their projects to life.

plugins.name: Pantone Hub
plugins.description:
Pantone Hub is your go-to tool for exploring and converting Pantone colors in Figma. Easily browse Pantone libraries or match your custom colors to their Pantone equivalents.


Color Picker:

  1. Choose a Pantone library of your choice.
  2. Browse through the complete list of colors from the selected library. Hover over any color to view its details.
  3. Click on a color to insert it as a token directly into your Figma canvas.
  4. Alternatively, select objects (e.g., rectangles, frames) on your canvas, then click on a color to apply it directly.


Color Converter:

  1. Select a Pantone library to search for matches.
  2. Input a HEX color value to find the nearest or exact Pantone match.
  3. The closest matching color will be displayed.
  4. Click on the color to insert it as a token into your Figma canvas.
  5. Alternatively, apply the color directly to selected objects (e.g., rectangles, frames) on your canvas.

accepted.name: mohan vadivel
accepted.description: Product Designer

plugins.tagline: Find, Access, Explore, and Convert Pantone Colors with Ease.

plugins.name: Sequential Text
plugins.description:
Sequential Text populates a range of text layers with a numeric sequence.


To use it, select the appropriate text layers, launch the plugin, enter the text that you want to appear in the first layer in your selection, then press Update Text. The plugin automatically identifies the suffix, how it should increment, and updates all the selected text layers with appropriately sequenced text.


It supports simple numbered suffixes, or more complex ranged suffixes with different separators.


Here are some examples of what a range of text layers would contain for a given input string.


Pattern: 1

Output: 1, 2, 3, 4, etc.


Pattern: Label 1

Output: Label 1, Label 2, Label 3, Label 4, etc.


Pattern: Faders 1-8

Output: Faders 1-8, Faders 9-16, Faders 17-24, Faders 25-32, etc.


Pattern: 1/2

Output: 1/2, 3/4, 5/6, 7/8, etc.


Pattern: 1 & 2

Output: 1 & 2, 3 & 4, 5 & 6, 7 & 8


Figma does not guarantee the ordering or layers in a selection, so you can choose how the plugin applies the sequence across the selcted items: in rows or in columns depending on the position of the layers.


Limitations

It does not support sequential prefixes. You’ll get odd results if you try to use labels that begin with numbers as the plugin thinks the following text is a range separator. I may change the way the sequential elements are identified to be less automagical, and more explicit.

accepted.name: Henry Bourne
accepted.description: Experience & Design @ Lawo

plugins.tagline: Populate a range of text layers with a numeric sequence

plugins.name: figma codegen
plugins.description:
Unlock the full potential of your design and development process with the Figma CodeGen Plugin, a state-of-the-art tool designed to seamlessly bridge the gap between UX designers and software engineers. This plugin leverages the latest in AI through ChatGPT-4, enhancing the automation of converting Figma components into executable code, including HTML tags, CSS classes, and instance directives.


Key Features:

General Settings: Streamline your workflow with customizable settings that allow you to set prefixes and establish masks for properties, CSS class names, and directives. Use placeholders that automatically fetch values from your design tokens to ensure precision and consistency across all your components.

Component-Specific Customization: Each component can be individually tailored with specific settings to meet its unique requirements. This feature enhances component adaptability and ensures your design's fidelity is maintained when translated into code.


  • Advanced Integration with ChatGPT-4: By integrating with ChatGPT-4, the plugin offers expanded capabilities in code generation, providing you with intelligent code suggestions and optimizations directly within Figma.
  • File-Level Configuration: Maintain consistent settings and ensure uniform code generation across your team by saving configurations at the file level. This promotes effective collaboration between designers and developers, making your workflow more efficient and reliable.


Get Started Today

Embrace a streamlined, integrated design-development workflow with the Figma CodeGen Plugin. Ensure your design system is flawlessly translated into precise web component code. 🚀


Support the Project:

https://www.buymeacoffee.com/lucbevilaqua

https://github.com/lucbevilaqua

plugins.name: Wavy
plugins.description:
Generate dynamic SVG waves on the fly

Craft stunning and dynamic SVG waves for your projects in seconds. Take your pick from three distinct wave styles: classic and smooth spline waves, sharp and edgy square waves, or the regular graph waves. Further personalize your waves with two different patterns - create a consistent flow with the periodic option, or embrace a more organic touch with the random pattern.


Unleash your creative control

Fine-tune every detail for precise control. Adjust the frequency to control the distance between wave peaks, and the amplitude to modify the wave's height. See your creation come to life in real-time with the live preview. This allows you to experiment and iterate until you achieve the perfect wave for your needs.


Seamless integration

Once you're happy with your masterpiece, easily add it into your web designs with a simple button click. SVG export ensures your waves look crisp and beautiful at any size, without sacrificing quality.
plugins.tagline: Level up your visual storytelling with dynamic SVG waves!

plugins.name: list breaker
plugins.description:
List Splitter is a Figma plugin designed to help you easily split list items into individual text layers, while retaining the width of the original text box. This plugin allows you to keep the same design style across list items and adjust the spacing and layout with precision.

Instructions for use:

  1. Select a text layer containing a list. Ensure that the list items are separated by line breaks.
  2. Run the List Splitter plugin from the Plugins menu.
  3. Click the "Split list items" button.
  4. The plugin will create individual text layers for each list item while maintaining the original width and design style.

Key Features:

  • Split list items into individual text layers
  • Retain the original width and design style of the text box
  • Adjust spacing and layout with precision

With List Splitter, you can easily manage and style your lists without the hassle of manually creating separate text layers for each item.
plugins.tagline: Break lists into individual text boxes

plugins.name: Icon sprite generator
plugins.description:
What does it even do?

Creating an SVG sprite for a set of system icons can be kind of difficult and often involve stringing multiple services together to achieve the desired result. So this is the problem this plugin aims to solve. One place to target, optimize and export a bunch of icons as one unified SVG sprite.


How to use?

The UI is broken up into a few different blocks, each with it's own impact on the SVG output.


// Target method

The target method is the way in which you specify which frames/icon you want to be included in your SVG sprite.


Current selection - This method allows you to manually select the individual frames you want to be included in the sprite output.

Layer key - This method allows you to specify a key word that may be included across multiple layer/frame names and will target every node with key word as a part of its name.



// Symbol colour

Every icon set is different and you may want your icons to be a specific colour, or to inherit their colour from their context, or you might just want to not specify a colour at all!


Inherit colour - Will use "currentcolor" in place of path and fill colours.

Custom colour - Allows you to override any existing path/fill colours with a custom hex/rgb/hsl.

Unset - Does nothing at all with the symbol colours!



// Symbol dimensions

By default the dimensions are set to the most common icon size (24px by 24px), which is also the current best practice for icon sizes on the web. The width and height can be changed to whatever you so desire and this will update the symbol "width" and "height" properties, as well as the SVG viewBox.



// Optimization

To help with SVG path spaghetti, you have the ability to optimize your SVG output. This can be configured and is achieved by using the open source SVGO optimization library.

accepted.name: Ethan Roxburgh
accepted.description: Senior Product Designer @ Fathom

plugins.tagline: Easily target, optimize and export layers as a custom svg sprite.

plugins.name: Detach Variables
plugins.description:
Version 18 Key Updates


👉 Now, number variables for line height, letter spacing, paragraph spacing, and paragraph indent can also be detached.

👉 The Detach Typography Variables feature has been added, allowing you to detach all variables within Typography, regardless of whether they are number or string-based.

👉 Typography with mixed styles can now be detached as well.

👉 When running Detach String Variables, font size, which is the only number variable, will also be detached—please keep this in mind.

👉 The UI changes introduced in Version 17 have been removed (they just seemed to make things more inconvenient…).


We’ve tested various cases internally, but unexpected bugs might still pop up.

Your valuable feedback helps us improve the service, so please share your thoughts with us! 🙏


Fund My Work →


Description


Here are the plug-ins you need for people who have spent unnecessary time on ‘variable detach’


🎉 Detach the variable colors or text applied to frames, groups, and sections with a single click.🎉


Reduce unnecessary clicks and start design work efficiently.🌝


💪Features

  1. Detach Color Variable
  2. Detach String Variable
  3. Detach Number Variable
  4. Detach Boolean Variable
  5. Detach Typography Variable
  6. Detach All Variable


🙌How to use it🙌


The plug-in can be run either by entering "Detach Variables" into the plugin search in the Figma file or via (win)Ctrl+/ or (Mac)cmd+/.


If you need a color, string, number detach, select the desired area before plug-in.


We plan to show off more features in the future! Please look forward to it😘

plugins.name: Link spacing variables
plugins.description:
Effortlessly link spacing variables to your design system, ensuring consistency and efficiency throughout the design process.


Depending on the scope you define for each variable, auto-layout spacings, width, height and corner radii can be linked.


How it works:

  1. Create a collection: Start by creating a collection that contains all your spacing variables (e.g. xs, sm, md etc.). Make sure you set the right scope for each variable.
  2. Select the layer(s): Choose the layer(s) in your design that you want to link with the spacing variables.
  3. Run Apply spacing variables command from the plugin menu. If it's your first time using the plugin, it will prompt you to specify the collection that holds the spacing variables. No worries - we'll save that selection.
  4. Automatic linking ✨: The plugin will automatically link all selected layers and any nested layers that utilize autolayout to the corresponding spacing keys in your collection.


Spacing variables won't be linked to nested instances: The plugin ignores nested instances of components within your selected layer(s) to prevent accidental overriding of values. You still have the flexibility to manually override values by explicitly selecting individual instances or layers within an instance.


Ensure the frame's mode matches spacing collection to apply correct values: If your spacing collection offers different modes based on viewport widths (e.g., desktop or mobile), it's crucial to ensure that the frame you're working on is set to the appropriate mode. This way, the plugin will apply the correct spacing values according to the chosen mode. Learn more about modes for variables.


Changing spacings collection: To change the spacing collection, simply navigate to the Apply spacing variables > Settings.


Github page

accepted.name: Lorenz Wöhr
accepted.description: Digital Designer (UX/UI) & Creative Director

plugins.tagline: Link spacing variables with your design system.

plugins.name: Mentor
plugins.description:
The All-in-One design helper to supercharge your design process. For all beginners and pros!


This plugin was made by a designer for designers. It offers a comprehensive library of design thinking methodologies, allows you to set up your design file, prepare for a design review with slide templates, and gives you an insight into the meeting structure of a genuine product design team. I created this plugin months ago for TripActions internally. Now I'm shipping the public version for the community in the hope it may make your life easier, regardless of your level.


This plugin does not store any data from you and never will! If you have improvement ideas, shoot them down in the comments or drop me an email hello@justali.co


I hope you enjoy this plugin as much as I enjoyed the process of making it.

plugins.name: AITranslator
plugins.description:
O plugin IATranslator é uma ferramenta inovadora para o Figma que revoluciona o processo de tradução de designs. Completamente em português, o IATranslator utiliza inteligência artificial avançada para simplificar e agilizar a tradução de frames no Figma.


Recursos Principais:

-Inteligência Artificial Avançada:

  • O IATranslator utiliza algoritmos de aprendizado de máquina para compreender o contexto e fornecer traduções mais precisas e naturalmente fluidas.

-Tradução Instantânea:

  • Traduza seus frames com apenas um clique, economizando tempo e eliminando a necessidade de copiar e colar texto em ferramentas externas.

-Contexto Preservado:

  • Graças à IA, o plugin preserva o contexto do design, garantindo que as traduções mantenham a integridade visual e a usabilidade do seu projeto.

-Revisão Colaborativa:

  • Colabore de maneira eficiente com sua equipe, permitindo revisões e ajustes nas traduções diretamente no Figma, mantendo todo o trabalho em um único ambiente.

-Suporte a Múltiplos Idiomas:

  • Traduza para e a partir de diversos idiomas, tornando o IATranslator uma ferramenta versátil para projetos com equipes globais ou destinados a diferentes mercados.

-Personalização de Traduções:

  • Adapte as traduções conforme necessário, permitindo ajustes manuais para garantir que o resultado final atenda às especificidades do seu projeto.

-Segurança e Privacidade:

  • Garantimos a segurança dos seus dados e designs. As traduções são processadas localmente no seu ambiente Figma, mantendo a confidencialidade do seu trabalho.
plugins.tagline: Tradutor de textos com IA

plugins.name: Mandala Maker
plugins.description:
Mandala Maker allows you to craft intricate mandala patterns from your own designs. It offers adjustable settings for segment count, element spacing, design rotation, and overall mandala size. You can also incorporate additional layers of complexity by adding an additional layer. 


Usage:


  • Select a vector or shape and load the plugin. 
  • Use the "Symmetry slider to adjust the number of symmetrical segments.
  • Modify the “Inner-Layer Spacing” and “Outer Layer Spacing” sliders to control the density of your design.
  • Change the Rotation Angle slider to set your orientation.
  • Check the “Add Second Layer” box if you desire an additional layer of complexity.
  • Opt for “Apply Size” Variation to introduce random variations and an organic feel to your mandala (The output will not be symmetric, but will display depth when number of segments are higher.)

 

Generate Your Mandala:

Once satisfied with your settings, click the Generate Mandala button to create your custom design.
plugins.tagline: Craft intricate mandalas from your own designs with ease: shape, rotate, size, and layer!

How it works

The Tiled plugin empowers designers by enabling them to create interactive experiences without relying on developers or web content platforms, giving them complete control over the end-to-end process while delivering creative assets at enterprise scale and speed.

plugins.name: Juliette - Generate accessible color combinations
plugins.description:
Based on your color palette, discover, generate and validate all the accessible color combinations you can have in a fast and easy way.


In this first version, you can generate all the AAA validated color combinations that your color palette allows. 


How to use it:

  1. Install the plugin 
  2. Run the plugin on your Figma File
  3. Define the base color on your color palette. Juliette will generate the extended palette with lighter and darker colours and the combinations available that validate AAA.
  4. Click “Export” and a new page will be created with all the possible combinations.


Stay tuned for the updates!

plugins.name: FigSheets
plugins.description:
FigSheets creates a spreadsheet for generating designs, right in Figma. It'll help you create and store multiple versions of a design without the error-prone copying and pasting OR detatching instances when you need to change one keyword or layer.


Using FigSheets is simple:


1. Create a sheet; specify the number of layers, keywords, or entire blocks of content you want to swap out of a template.


2. Add your Master Template to the "MASTER" cell (the blue tabbed cell). This is the design you'll create alternate versions of.


3. Add the layers, content, or keywords in the appropriately labeled red-tabbed cells.


4. Add the "Override" information in those red tabs. When you "Sync" the sheet, FigSheets will look for the layer names or keywords to create new versions of your Master.


5. Hit "Sync!" Alternate versions should appear like magic.


Tip: If you want to generate Components, just make your Master Template a Component or Instance. The components will inherit the name of the Master Template and append the text in the purple "RESULT" tab (which you can rename).

accepted.name: Will Berger
accepted.description: UX/UI Designer at Capital One

plugins.name: Universal Hyperlinker
plugins.description:
Description:


Transform your Figma design elements into interactive portals with the Universal Hyperlinker! This tool enables you to instantly turn shapes, images, or frames into clickable hyperlinks, facilitating seamless navigation within your design files. Experience real-world web interaction right on the Figma canvas.


Features:


  • Broad Element Support: Hyperlink shapes, images, or frames effortlessly.
  • Batch Hyperlinking: Accelerate your workflow by linking multiple elements simultaneously.
  • User-Friendly Interface: Our intuitive UI makes hyperlinking quick and straightforward.
  • Flexible URLs: Enter either full URLs or just the domain part—both work flawlessly.
  • Versatile Interaction: Hyperlinks remain clickable on the canvas, in prototypes, and in PDF exports.
  • Dynamic Clickable Areas: Hyperlink regions automatically adjust to your object's dimensions.


Ideal for designers seeking efficiency, Universal Hyperlinker is the ultimate plugin to create interactive, navigable mockups that mirror actual web functionality. Activate clickable links in your designs and elevate your prototyping process with Universal Hyperlinker.

plugins.name: Color Extractly 🎨 | Extract Colors from Any Text or Code
plugins.description:
Your go-to sorcery for pulling colors out of any text or code!

Simply paste any code or text—from a snippet to full website code—and watch as our plugin effortlessly extracts vibrant color values. No perfection needed, just paste and let the magic unfold! 🪄✨

+ Generates and aligns Design Systems in seconds!


✨ Key Features

  1. ✅ Instant Color Extraction: Directly pull color values from text and code.
  2. 🔖 Auto-Organize, Group & Name: Streamline your workflow with automatic color sorting and naming for better management.
  3. 📝 Text-to-Color Variables & Styles: Easily create and manage color variables & styles from textual input, ready for Figma.
  4. 🚀 Effortless Integration: Seamlessly import colors into Figma, allowing immediate application to your designs.
  5. 🔄 Clean & Tidy UI: Maintain a clutter-free color palette by eliminating redundant colors automatically.
  6. ✏️ Distill Typo to Text Styles
  7. 🔤 Add Matching Text Style(s) to Element(s)
  8. 🔢 Distill Number Attributes to Variables
  9. 🔄 Replace Number Attributes with Variables
  10. 🌈 Replace Color(s) with Variables/Styles
  11. 💫 Reset All Instance Overrides (except images & text)
  12. 🎭 Generate Component Sets from Selections
  13. ✂️ Auto Image Crop for transparent and similar-colored edges
  14. ---
  15. 💥 Destroy all variables and styles
  16. 💀 Destroy all Instances


🎨 Color Management

  1. Extract colors from code snippets, text, and CSS
  2. Extract colors from Figma selection (fills, strokes, text)
  3. Replace colors with matching local or library styles
  4. Auto-detect and preserve variable names from CSS/SCSS/LESS
  5. Smart color matching with configurable threshold
  6. Preserve opacity and color relationships
  7. Smart naming from layer structure and code
  8. User-controlled naming through layer organization
  9. Preserves design system hierarchies
  10. Automatic semantic color naming


🔄 Variable & Style Management

  1. Convert text layers to reusable text styles
  2. ↳ Use -- prefix in layer names for custom style naming
  3. ↳ Supports nested style groups via layer names
  4. ↳ Example: --headline-mobile-h2 → "Headline/mobile/h2"
  5. Create variables from numeric properties (spacing, sizes)
  6. Replace numbers with matching local or library variables
  7. Smart matching for similar values and properties
  8. Bulk apply styles across selected elements
  9. Naming based on layer and frame structure
  10. Smart detection of design patterns
  11. Preserves component naming hierarchies
  12. Context-aware variable naming


🧩 Component Tools

  1. Convert selections to components or component sets
  2. Replace elements with matching components
  3. Smart component organization and property detection
  4. Cross-library component replacement support


🔄 Instance Management

  1. Selectively reset instance overrides
  2. Reset colors, typography, effects, or layout
  3. Preserve specific overrides while resetting others
  4. Batch process multiple instances


🧹 Cleanup & Organization

  1. Remove redundant colors automatically
  2. Group similar colors and properties
  3. Auto-generate meaningful variable names
  4. Maintain clean, organized style libraries


💣 Cleanup & Reset Tools

  1. Remove styles and variables from selected elements
  2. Detach instances while preserving appearance
  3. Clean up unused styles and properties
  4. Remove hidden layers automatically
  5. Smart component restoration capabilities
  6. Batch processing for multiple elements


🖼️ Image Tools

  1. Batch process image fills across multiple elements instantly
  2. Trim transparent and solid-colored edges from selected images
  3. Set image fills to Fit for clean scaling inside containers
  4. Set image fills to Fill for edge-to-edge visual coverage
  5. Tile image fills for repeating patterns and textures


💡 Smart Features

  1. Automatic color format detection (HEX, RGB, HSL)
  2. Smart variable naming based on context
  3. Configurable matching thresholds
  4. Cross-library style and variable support
  5. Bulk processing capabilities


🛠️ User Experience

  1. Clean, intuitive interface
  2. Quick filters and search functionality
  3. Real-time preview of changes
  4. Undo/redo support
  5. Detailed tooltips and documentation

plugins.name: SVG to Code
plugins.description:
Transform vectors into SVG variables and create custom code to export batches of icons faster.


How to use :

  • Select vectors you want to exports (only vectors, not group of vector or anything else)
  • Run the Svg To Code plugin
  • Use variables as you want
  • Click on Copy to clipboard button
  • You're ready to paste the result in your project ! 🎉

plugins.name: Deep Focus
plugins.description:

- Load any youtube playlist by list id

Usage:
1. Go to any public playlist on Youtube.
2. You should see a url like: "https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLFMTDS4p0b5hSxRVlab3wwbZwKTjUxa2L", copy that.
3. Run the plugin.
4. Paste and click on 'load'.
5. ⏯ 😇 ☮️

plugins.name: AlphaMasker
plugins.description:
Quickly turn transparent frames or PNGs into masked knockout fill frames.


  1. Select a frame with transparency
  2. Run AlphaMasker
  3. Change the color of the resulting frame


AlphaMasker uses the selected frame to generate a transparent PNG which it uses as a mask layer for a solid color. This lets you quickly generate solid-color knockout illustrations with adjustable colors.
